article.headline: Detroit 76, Wis.-Green Bay 72
article.story: DETROIT (AP) -- Brandon Cotton scored a career-high 31 points Thursday and made three big shots down the stretch to lead Detroit to a 76-72 victory over Wisconsin-Green Bay. Brandon Bell added a career-high 15 points as the Titans (9-13, 5-5 Horizon League) completed a season sweep of the Phoenix and moved into a third-place tie in the conference standings. Mike Schachtner had 21 points and Ryan Tillema added 18 for Green Bay (12-11, 4-6). Cotton scored Detroit's last 11 points, including three 3-pointers that gave the Titans some breathing room after the Phoenix cut the lead to three points. The last one, with 16.4 seconds to play, gave Detroit 75-69 lead. Detroit, which never trailed, was 6-for-7 from the floor in the first five minutes of the second half and outscored Green Bay 13-2 to push its lead into double digits. The Phoenix got back into the game with an 11-3 run but never got closer than three points. The Titans closed the first half on a 6-1 run and led 30-25 at intermission. Reserve Jon Goode had 10 points and five assists for Detroit. Ryan Evanochko had 14 points and nine assists for Green Bay.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
